content: Actor Chuck Norris told WorldNetDaily that he would be interested in being President of Texas should the state secede from the union: "http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/2009/03/11/chuck-norris-for-president-%e2%80%a6-of-texas/" "http://www.worldnetdaily.com/index.php?fa=PAGE.view&pageId=91103" quote: “I may run for president of Texas,” Norris wrote Monday in a column posted at WorldNetDaily. “That need may be a reality sooner than we think. If not me, someone someday may again be running for president of the Lone Star state, if the state of the union continues to turn into the enemy of the state.” The actor claimed “thousands of cell groups will be united around the country in solidarity over the concerns for our nation” and said that if states decide to secede from the union, that Texas would lead the way. “Anyone who has been around Texas for any length of time knows exactly what we'd do if the going got rough in America,” Norris wrote. “Let there be no doubt about that.” Sounds like Chuck is aching to wear Gitmo Orange in the near future
quote: “I may run for president of Texas,” Norris wrote Monday in a column posted at WorldNetDaily. “That need may be a reality sooner than we think. If not me, someone someday may again be running for president of the Lone Star state, if the state of the union continues to turn into the enemy of the state.” The actor claimed “thousands of cell groups will be united around the country in solidarity over the concerns for our nation” and said that if states decide to secede from the union, that Texas would lead the way. “Anyone who has been around Texas for any length of time knows exactly what we'd do if the going got rough in America,” Norris wrote. “Let there be no doubt about that.”

title: Chuck Norris For President - of Texas

content: quote: Actor Chuck Norris told WorldNetDaily that he would be interested in being President of Texas should the state secede from the union: Do you honestly think Texas or an any state has that Option and could do anything about it? Regardless of that...Succession is a waste of time, effort and the wrong approach. People need to band together in all states and make a huge statement to all congress, the senate and the Whitehouse. That statement is The FairTax. It would work and it would place this nation at the very top of the economic super power. Not to mention it would show out government that "we the people" do have a voice. These secessionist movement people need to stop wasting time on a fantasy and place it in the FairTax movement. A much more realistic change than Succesion. Where is the devotionm to the US Flag in these people? Border line of being traitors and rebels in my view.
quote: Actor Chuck Norris told WorldNetDaily that he would be interested in being President of Texas should the state secede from the union:
reply: Do you honestly think Texas or an any state has that Option and could do anything about it? Regardless of that...Succession is a waste of time, effort and the wrong approach. People need to band together in all states and make a huge statement to all congress, the senate and the Whitehouse. That statement is The FairTax. It would work and it would place this nation at the very top of the economic super power. Not to mention it would show out government that "we the people" do have a voice. These secessionist movement people need to stop wasting time on a fantasy and place it in the FairTax movement. A much more realistic change than Succesion. Where is the devotionm to the US Flag in these people? Border line of being traitors and rebels in my view.
title: Chuck Norris For President - of Texas

content: Actually, Texas refused to join the Union without a secession clause... so they DO have the right to secede. And I don't think Chuck Norris is afraid of Gitmo... after all it'll be closed soon anyway ;-) I supported Huckabee/Norris last year. The "Speak softly and carry a big kick" ticket ;-) "Common sense isn't."

Texas did not just succeed from the Union, they went to War with the United States, which negated that portion of the original agreement. Todays Texas Constitution no longer contains that provision. Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by Gladewalker: Actually, Texas refused to join the Union without a secession clause... so they DO have the right to secede. And I don't think Chuck Norris is afraid of Gitmo... after all it'll be closed soon anyway ;-) I supported Huckabee/Norris last year. The "Speak softly and carry a big kick" ticket ;-) Chuck (and those foolish enough to follow him) have apparently forgotten how things turned out the last time a group of states decided to try and secede - they got their azzes handed to them, and lost a few cities due to them being burned to the ground by the victorious Union armies. If they were dumb enough to try it again, the beating they would get would be even more lopsided, and we'd spend years watching FLIR/night vision footage of them being hunted down like the Taliban just before a JDAM or Hellfire is dropped down on top of them. Not to mention that I doubt the Union would be anywhere near as kind to them a second time around come surrender time. Is getting your panties in a wad over an election that didn't go your way worth all that trouble and destruction?

content: quote: Originally posted by Gladewalker: Actually, Texas refused to join the Union without a secession clause... so they DO have the right to secede. And I don't think Chuck Norris is afraid of Gitmo... after all it'll be closed soon anyway ;-) I supported Huckabee/Norris last year. The "Speak softly and carry a big kick" ticket ;-) True, but outdated. Texas did not just succeed from the Union, they went to War with the United States, which negated that portion of the original agreement. If Texas had simply pulled out of the Union without joining the other States in Their treason, they probably could have gotten away with it. Todays Texas Constitution no longer contains that provision. Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by Gladewalker: Actually, Texas refused to join the Union without a secession clause... so they DO have the right to secede. And I don't think Chuck Norris is afraid of Gitmo... after all it'll be closed soon anyway ;-) I supported Huckabee/Norris last year. The "Speak softly and carry a big kick" ticket ;-) Chuck (and those foolish enough to follow him) have apparently forgotten how things turned out the last time a group of states decided to try and secede - they got their azzes handed to them, and lost a few cities due to them being burned to the ground by the victorious Union armies. If they were dumb enough to try it again, the beating they would get would be even more lopsided, and we'd spend years watching FLIR/night vision footage of them being hunted down like the Taliban just before a JDAM or Hellfire is dropped down on top of them. Not to mention that I doubt the Union would be anywhere near as kind to them a second time around come surrender time. Is getting your panties in a wad over an election that didn't go your way worth all that trouble and destruction?

title: Chuck Norris For President - of Texas

content: Actor Chuck Norris told WorldNetDaily that he would be interested in being President of Texas should the state secede from the union: "http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/2009/03/11/chuck-norris-for-president-%e2%80%a6-of-texas/" "http://www.worldnetdaily.com/index.php?fa=PAGE.view&pageId=91103" quote: “I may run for president of Texas,” Norris wrote Monday in a column posted at WorldNetDaily. “That need may be a reality sooner than we think. If not me, someone someday may again be running for president of the Lone Star state, if the state of the union continues to turn into the enemy of the state.” The actor claimed “thousands of cell groups will be united around the country in solidarity over the concerns for our nation” and said that if states decide to secede from the union, that Texas would lead the way. “Anyone who has been around Texas for any length of time knows exactly what we'd do if the going got rough in America,” Norris wrote. “Let there be no doubt about that.” Sounds like Chuck is aching to wear Gitmo Orange in the near future
quote: “I may run for president of Texas,” Norris wrote Monday in a column posted at WorldNetDaily. “That need may be a reality sooner than we think. If not me, someone someday may again be running for president of the Lone Star state, if the state of the union continues to turn into the enemy of the state.” The actor claimed “thousands of cell groups will be united around the country in solidarity over the concerns for our nation” and said that if states decide to secede from the union, that Texas would lead the way. “Anyone who has been around Texas for any length of time knows exactly what we'd do if the going got rough in America,” Norris wrote. “Let there be no doubt about that.”

content: quote: Actor Chuck Norris told WorldNetDaily that he would be interested in being President of Texas should the state secede from the union: Do you honestly think Texas or an any state has that Option and could do anything about it? Regardless of that...Succession is a waste of time, effort and the wrong approach. People need to band together in all states and make a huge statement to all congress, the senate and the Whitehouse. That statement is The FairTax. It would work and it would place this nation at the very top of the economic super power. Not to mention it would show out government that "we the people" do have a voice. These secessionist movement people need to stop wasting time on a fantasy and place it in the FairTax movement. A much more realistic change than Succesion. Where is the devotionm to the US Flag in these people? Border line of being traitors and rebels in my view.
